adjective.description: (of information, measurements, statistics, etc.) correct in all details; exact.
examples: accurate information about the illness is essential

adjective.description: (with reference to a weapon, missile, or shot) capable of or successful in reaching the intended target.
examples: a player who can deliver long accurate passes

origin: Late 16th century: from Latin accuratus done with care, past participle of accurare, from ad- towards + cura care.
